title: 1907 Fenerbahce
body:
Does anyone know why casters keep calling this team by its full name? I mean, "Nine-teen-oh-seven-Fe-ner-bah-ce"- it's a bit ridiculous because of how much time it takes to pronounce it. Something like FBC would be more convenient.
Legit curious.

replies.body: because they generally call every team by their full name, it's a respect thing.

"Generally" - maybe, but certainly not always. For example, Royal Never Give Up is more often referred to as RNG, the only time I hear the full version is on the analyst desk, which is understandable, but in games it's almost always RNG.

That varies from team to team. Some teams (not many but some) refer to themselves via an abbreviation over the full team name. These teams are often teams with significantly longer names.
Royal Never Give Up (RNG)
SK Telecom T1 (SKT)
Team Solo Mid (TSM)
Counter Logic Gaming (CLG)
Hard 2 Kill Gaming (H2K)
EDward Gaming (EDG)

All of the above teams prefer their abbreviated names.
